enumerated_values.description: DMA transfer is not yet complete. Writing a 0 has no effect.
DMA transfer completed. Writing a 1 to this bit clears all DMA status bits and should be used in an interrupt service routine to clear the DMA interrupt and error bits.
DMA channel is inactive. Cleared when the DMA has finished the last transaction.
BSY is set the first time the channel is enabled after a transfer is initiated.
No request is pending or the channel is currently active. Cleared when the channel is selected.
The DMA channel has a transfer remaining and the channel is not selected.
The DMA channel terminated with a bus error during the write portion of a transfer.
The DMA channel terminated with a bus error during the read portion of a transfer.

registers.name: DSR_BCR0

enumerated_values.description: Perform a link to channel LCH1 after each cycle-steal transfer followed by a link to LCH2 after the BCR decrements to zero
Perform a link to channel LCH1 after each cycle-steal transfer
Perform a link to channel LCH1 after the BCR decrements to zero
ERQ bit is cleared when the BCR is exhausted.
The DMA begins the transfer in accordance to the values in the TCDn. START is cleared automatically after one module clock and always reads as logic 0.
Reserved (generates a configuration error (DSRn[CE]) if incorrectly specified at time of channel activation)
No change to the DAR after a successful transfer.
The DAR increments by 1, 2, 4 depending upon the size of the transfer.
Reserved (generates a configuration error (DSRn[CE]) if incorrectly specified at time of channel activation)
No change to SAR after a successful transfer.
The SAR increments by 1, 2, 4 as determined by the transfer size.

If SSIZE indicates a transfer no smaller than DSIZE, source accesses are auto-aligned; otherwise, destination accesses are auto-aligned. Source alignment takes precedence over destination alignment. If auto-alignment is enabled, the appropriate address register increments, regardless of DINC or SINC.
DMA continuously makes read/write transfers until the BCR decrements to 0.
Forces a single read/write transfer per request.
Enables peripheral request to initiate transfer. A software-initiated request (setting the START bit) is always enabled.

fields.name: MULT

enumerated_values.description: DMA transfer is enabled and the following conditions trigger the DMA request: While FACK = 0, a data byte is received, either address or data is transmitted. (ACK/NACK automatic) While FACK = 0, the first byte received matches the A1 register or is general call address. If any address matching occurs, IAAS and TCF are set. If the direction of transfer is known from master to slave, then it is not required to check the SRW. With this assumption, DMA can also be used in this case. In other cases, if the master reads data from the slave, then it is required to rewrite the C1 register operation. With this assumption, DMA cannot be used. When FACK = 1, an address or a data byte is transmitted.
Normal operation. No interrupt generated when address matching in low power mode.
Enables the wakeup function in low power mode.
An acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving byte (if FACK is set).
No acknowledge signal is sent to the bus on the following receiving data byte (if FACK is cleared) or the current receiving data byte (if FACK is set).
Acknowledge signal was received after the completion of one byte of data transmission on the bus
Slave receive, master writing to slave
Slave transmit, master reading from slave
Range mode disabled. No address match occurs for an address within the range of values of the A1 and RA registers.
Range mode enabled. Address matching occurs when a slave receives an address within the range of values of the A1 and RA registers.
The slave baud rate follows the master baud rate and clock stretching may occur
Slave baud rate is independent of the master baud rate

Break character is detected at length of 11 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 14 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 15 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

Break character is transmitted with length of 10 bit times (if M = 0, SBNS = 0) or 11 (if M = 1, SBNS = 0 or M = 0, SBNS = 1) or 12 (if M = 1, SBNS = 1 or M10 = 1, SNBS = 0) or 13 (if M10 = 1, SNBS = 1).

LSB (bit0) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit0.

MSB (bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6) is the first bit that is transmitted following the start bit depending on the setting of C1[M], C1[PE] and C4[M10]. Further, the first bit received after the start bit is identified as bit9, bit8, bit7 or bit6 depending on the setting of C1[M] and C1[PE].

All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN1 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA2 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer.
All data received is transferred to the data buffer if MAEN2 is cleared.

All data received with the most significant bit cleared, is discarded. All data received with the most significant bit set, is compared with contents of MA1 register. If no match occurs, the data is discarded. If match occurs, data is transferred to the data buffer.

peripherals.description: Universal Serial Bus, OTG Capable Controller
peripherals.name: USB0

fields.description: Ones complement of peripheral identification bits.
fields.name: NID

fields.description: When this bit is set, the USB peripheral is operating in host mode.
fields.name: IEHOST

fields.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on an A device.
fields.name: AVBUSCHG

fields.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected on a B device.
fields.name: B_SESS_CHG

fields.description: This bit is set when a change in VBUS is detected indicating a session valid or a session no longer valid
fields.name: SESSVLDCHG

fields.description: This bit is set when the USB line state changes
fields.name: LINE_STATE_CHG

fields.description: This bit is set when the 1 millisecond timer expires
fields.name: ONEMSEC

fields.description: This bit is set when a change in the ID Signal from the USB connector is sensed.
fields.name: IDCHG

enumerated_values.description: The VBUS voltage is below the A VBUS Valid threshold.
The VBUS voltage is above the A VBUS Valid threshold.
The VBUS voltage is above the B session end threshold.
The VBUS voltage is below the B session end threshold.
The VBUS voltage is below the B session valid threshold
The VBUS voltage is above the B session valid threshold.

fields.description: Indicates that the internal signals that control the LINE_STATE_CHG field of OTGISTAT are stable for at least 1 millisecond

enumerated_values.description: The LINE_STAT_CHG bit is not yet stable.
The LINE_STAT_CHG bit has been debounced and is stable.

fields.name: LINESTATESTABLE

fields.description: This bit is reserved for the 1ms count, but it is not useful to software.
fields.name: ONEMSECEN

fields.description: Indicates the current state of the ID pin on the USB connector

enumerated_values.description: Indicates a Type A cable is plugged into the USB connector.
Indicates no cable is attached or a Type B cable is plugged into the USB connector.

fields.name: ID

enumerated_values.description: If USB_EN is 1 and HOST_MODE is 0 in the Control Register (CTL), then the D+ Data Line pull-up resistors are enabled. If HOST_MODE is 1 the D+ and D- Data Line pull-down resistors are engaged.
The pull-up and pull-down controls in this register are used.

fields.description: D- Data Line pull-down resistor enable

enumerated_values.description: D- pulldown resistor is not enabled.

fields.name: DMLOW

fields.description: D+ Data Line pull-down resistor enable

enumerated_values.description: D+ pulldown resistor is not enabled.

fields.name: DPLOW

fields.description: D+ Data Line pullup resistor enable

enumerated_values.description: D+ pullup resistor is not enabled

fields.name: DPHIGH

fields.description: This bit is set when the USB Module has decoded a valid USB reset
fields.name: USBRST

fields.description: This bit is set when any of the error conditions within Error Interrupt Status (ERRSTAT) register occur
fields.name: ERROR

fields.description: This bit is set when the USB Module receives a Start Of Frame (SOF) token
fields.name: SOFTOK

fields.description: This bit is set when the current token being processed has completed
fields.name: TOKDNE

fields.description: This bit is set when the USB Module detects a constant idle on the USB bus for 3 ms
fields.name: SLEEP

fields.description: This bit is set depending upon the DP/DM signals, and can be used to signal remote wake-up signaling on the USB bus
fields.name: RESUME

fields.description: This bit is set when the PID check field fails.
fields.name: PIDERR

fields.description: This error interrupt has two functions
fields.name: CRC5EOF

fields.description: This bit is set when a data packet is rejected due to a CRC16 error.
fields.name: CRC16

fields.description: This bit is set if the data field received was not 8 bits in length
fields.name: DFN8

fields.description: This bit is set when a bus turnaround timeout error occurs
fields.name: BTOERR

fields.description: This bit is set if the USB Module has requested a DMA access to read a new BDT but has not been given the bus before it needs to receive or transmit data
fields.name: DMAERR

fields.description: This bit is set when a bit stuff error is detected
fields.name: BTSERR

fields.description: This bit is set if the last buffer descriptor updated was in the odd bank of the BDT.
fields.name: ODD

enumerated_values.description: The most recent transaction was a receive operation.
The most recent transaction was a transmit operation.

fields.description: This four-bit field encodes the endpoint address that received or transmitted the previous token
fields.name: ENDP

fields.description: Setting this bit to 1 resets all the BDT ODD ping/pong fields to 0, which then specifies the EVEN BDT bank
fields.name: ODDRST

fields.description: When set to 1 this bit enables the USB Module to execute resume signaling
fields.name: RESUME

fields.description: When set to 1, this bit enables the USB Module to operate in Host mode
fields.name: HOSTMODEEN

fields.description: Setting this bit enables the USB Module to generate USB reset signaling
fields.name: RESET

fields.description: In Host mode, TOKEN_BUSY is set when the USB module is busy executing a USB token
fields.name: TXSUSPENDTOKENBUSY

fields.description: Live USB Single Ended Zero signal
fields.name: SE0

fields.description: Live USB differential receiver JSTATE signal
fields.name: JSTATE

fields.description: Provides address bits 15 through 9 of the BDT base address.
fields.name: BDTBA

fields.description: This 8-bit field and the 3-bit field in the Frame Number Register High are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory
fields.name: FRM

fields.description: This 3-bit field and the 8-bit field in the Frame Number Register Low are used to compute the address where the current Buffer Descriptor Table (BDT) resides in system memory
fields.name: FRM

fields.description: Holds the Endpoint address for the token command
fields.name: TOKENENDPT

fields.description: Contains the token type executed by the USB module.

enumerated_values.description: OUT Token. USB Module performs an OUT (TX) transaction.
IN Token. USB Module performs an In (RX) transaction.

fields.name: TOKENPID

fields.description: Represents the SOF count threshold in byte times.
fields.name: CNT

fields.description: Provides address bits 23 through 16 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory
fields.name: BDTBA

fields.description: Provides address bits 31 through 24 of the BDT base address that defines the location of Buffer Descriptor Table resides in system memory
fields.name: BDTBA

fields.description: Enables the weak pulldowns on the USB transceiver.

enumerated_values.description: Weak pulldowns are disabled on D+ and D-.
Weak pulldowns are enabled on D+ and D-.

fields.name: PDE

enumerated_values.description: USB transceiver is not in suspend state.
USB transceiver is in suspend state.

fields.name: SUSP

fields.name: DMPD

fields.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pulldown . signal output from the USB OTG module
fields.name: DPPD

fields.description: Provides observability of the D+ Pullup . signal output from the USB OTG module
fields.name: DPPU

DP Pullup in non-OTG device mode is enabled.

USB asynchronous wakeup from suspend mode disabled.
